ground_truth: Mary looks at his smile, has to respond, pulls him to her, and kisses him. Then, without breaking the kiss, she swings her legs over the side of the bed, toe-searches around, finds her shoes, and slips her feet into them. Finally, she pulls away and sits up. She rises, goes to the bureau, takes a pair of small earrings out of her bag, and begins putting them on, not bothering or perhaps not wanting to look at herself in the mirror. Sam watches her, concerned but unable to inhibit his cheery, humorous good mood. Throughout the remainder of this scene, they occupy themselves with dressing, hair-combing, etc. She stares at him, surprised at his willingness to continue the affair on her terms, as girls are so often surprised when they discover men will continue to want them even after the sexual bait has been pulled in. Sam smiles reassuringly, places his hands gently on her arms, and speaks with gentle and simple sincerity. He moves away, and again the weight of his pain and problems crushes away his good humor. He looks at her long, pulls her close, kisses her lightly, looks out the window, and stares at the wide sky. Mary goes out quickly, closing the door behind her, as Sam stares down at his shoeless feet. A small, moderately successful office off the main street, we see Mary get out of a cab, pay the driver, cross the pavement to the office door. Mary enters the office, crosses to her desk, sits down, rubs her temples, and finally looks over at Caroline, a girl in the last of her teens. Caroline rises and starts for Mary's desk, pills in hand, but breaks off, distracted by the SOUND of the door opening. MR. LOWERY and his oil-lease client, TOM CASSIDY, enter the office. Lowery flashes an embarrassed smile at Mary and tries to lead Cassidy toward the private office. Cassidy pauses beside Mary's desk, hooks a haunch onto the desktop, and smiles a wet smile at Mary. Mary glances but cannot bring herself to smile or make some remark, continues sorting out the deed copies, and tries to ignore the man's hot-breath closeness. Cassidy rises, reels toward Lowery's office, pauses, turns, and speaks to Mary meaningfully. Lowery starts after him but pauses and turns to Mary. Cassidy has gone into Lowery's office. Lowery starts quickly away when it looks like Cassidy is going to come and pull him bodily into the office. When the men are gone and the door is closed, Caroline picks up a bundle and smiles at it. Mary has put one bundle into a large envelope and takes the other from Caroline. When the bills are away, she puts the filled envelope in her handbag, notices the remaining deed copies on her desk, picks them up, goes to the private office door, knocks, and starts to open the door as.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Mary is looked at by his smile, which has to be responded to, is pulled to her by him, and is kissed. Then, without the kiss being broken, her legs are swung over the side of the bed, her shoes are toe-searched for, found, and slipped onto her feet by her. Finally, she is pulled away and sat up. The bureau is gone to by her, a pair of small earrings are taken out of her bag, and they are begun to be put on by her, not bothering or perhaps not wanting to look at herself in the mirror. She is watched by Sam, who is concerned but unable to inhibit his cheery, humorous good mood. Throughout the remainder of this scene, they occupy themselves with dressing, hair-combing, etc. He is stared at by her, surprised at his willingness to continue the affair on her terms, as girls are so often surprised when they discover men will continue wanting them even after the sexual bait has been pulled in by them. Reassuringly, a smile is given by Sam, his hands are placed gently on her arms, and gentle and simple sincerity is spoken by him. He moves away, and again his good humor is crushed away by the weight of his pain and problems. Her is looked at by him long, she is pulled close, he kisses her lightly, out the window is looked at by him, and the wide sky is stared at. Mary goes out quickly, the door is closed behind her, as his shoeless feet are stared at by Sam. A small, moderately successful office off the main street is where we see a cab being got out of by Mary, the driver is paid by her, the pavement is crossed to the office door. The office is entered by Mary, her desk is crossed to, she sits down, her temples are rubbed, and Caroline, a girl in the last of her teens, is finally looked over at by her. Caroline rises and starts for Mary's desk, holding pills, but is distracted by the SOUND of the door opening. The office is entered by MR. LOWERY and his oil-lease client, TOM CASSIDY. An embarrassed smile is flashed at Mary by Lowery, and Cassidy is tried to be led toward the private office by him. Mary's desk is paused beside by Cassidy, whose haunch is hooked onto the desktop, and a wet smile is given to Mary by him. But she cannot bring herself to smile or make a remark, so she continues sorting out the deed copies and tries to ignore Cassidy's hot-breath closeness. Cassidy rises, reels toward Lowery's office, pauses, turns, and speaks to Mary meaningfully. Lowery starts after him but pauses and turns to Mary. Lowery's office is gone into by Cassidy. Lowery starts quickly away when it looks like Cassidy is going to come and pull him bodily into the office. When the men are gone and the door is closed, a bundle is picked up and smiled at by Caroline. One bundle is put into a large envelope by Mary, who takes the other from Caroline. When the bills are away, the filled envelope is put in her handbag by her, the remaining deed copies on her desk are noticed, and they are picked up by her as she goes to the private office door, knocks, and starts to open the door.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description:
Mary responds to his smile, pulls him to her, and kisses him. Without breaking the kiss, she swings her legs off the bed, finds her shoes with her toes, and puts them on. She then rises, goes to the bureau, takes out small earrings, and puts them on, avoiding the mirror. Sam watches, concerned yet unable to suppress his cheerful mood. As they dress and groom, Mary is surprised by his willingness to continue the affair on her terms, as women often are when men remain interested after the initial attraction. Sam reassures her with a gentle smile, places his hands on her arms, and speaks sincerely. He then pulls her close, kisses her lightly, and looks out at the sky, his humor fading with his burdens. Mary exits quickly, closing the door, while Sam stares at his shoeless feet.

At a small office on the main street, Mary gets out of a cab, pays the driver, and enters. She sits at her desk, rubs her temples, and looks at Caroline, a girl in her late teens. As Caroline approaches with pills, the sound of the door distracts her. MR. LOWERY and his oil-lease client, TOM CASSIDY, enter. Lowery smiles awkwardly at Mary and leads Cassidy to the private office. Cassidy pauses by Mary's desk and smiles at her. Mary glances but avoids engaging, continuing to sort deed copies. Cassidy then heads to Lowery's office. When Cassidy is inside, Lowery quickly follows. Once the men are gone and the door closes, Caroline picks up a bundle and smiles. Mary places one bundle in an envelope, takes another from Caroline, and puts it in her handbag. She then picks up the remaining deed copies, knocks on the private office door, and starts to enter.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Mary responds to his smile by pulling him close and kissing him. Without breaking the kiss, she swings her legs off the bed, finds her shoes, and slips them on. She pulls away, rises, and puts on earrings without looking in the mirror, as Sam watches her, cheerful despite concern. They continue dressing and grooming. She is surprised by his commitment to the affair and his reassuring smile. He gently speaks to her, then his mood dims, burdened by his troubles. After kissing her lightly, he gazes out the window. Mary exits quickly, shutting the door, while Sam looks at his bare feet. At a small office, Mary exits a cab, pays the driver, and enters. She sits at her desk, rubs her temples, and looks at Caroline, who approaches with pills but stops as MR. LOWERY and his client TOM CASSIDY enter. Lowery gives Mary an awkward smile and leads Cassidy to his office. Cassidy pauses to smile at Mary, who avoids acknowledging him and focuses on deed copies. Cassidy enters Lowery's office. After the men close the door, Caroline smiles at a bundle, and Mary puts it in an envelope in her bag, notices other deeds, and knocks on the private office door.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Mary, observing the radiant smile on his face, feels compelled to respond. She reaches out and pulls him toward her, pressing her lips to his in a tender, lingering kiss. Without breaking their intimate connection, she adeptly swings her legs over the side of the bed. Her toes sweep the floor in search of her shoes until she finds them, slipping her feet comfortably into each one. At last, she gently pulls away, sitting up to steady herself. Rising gracefully, she moves to the bureau, retrieves a pair of delicate, small earrings from her bag, and begins to put them on, choosing not to glance at her reflection in the mirror—whether out of indifference or a deliberate desire to avoid it is unclear. Sam watches her intently, his face marked by concern, yet he remains unable to suppress his cheerful, humorous disposition. Throughout the rest of this scene, they both attend to tasks such as dressing and combing their hair. She gazes at him, taken aback by his readiness to sustain the affair under her terms. It is a revelation that astonishes many women when they realize that men often remain interested even after the initial allure has subsided. With reassuring warmth, Sam gently places his hands on her arms, speaking with unadorned sincerity. Yet as he moves away, the weight of his own burdens presses down, dissipating the lightness of his earlier humor. He gazes at her intently before drawing her closer for a tender, fleeting kiss, then turns his attention to the expansive sky outside. Mary exits swiftly, closing the door behind her, as Sam, lost in thought, stares down at his bare feet. The scene shifts to a modestly successful office located just off the main street. We see Mary step out of a cab, pay the driver, and cross the pavement to enter the office building. Once inside, she walks directly to her desk, sits, massages her temples in an attempt to relieve the tension, and eventually looks over at Caroline, a young woman just out of her teens. Caroline rises with a start and begins to approach Mary's desk, a bottle of pills in her hand, but is interrupted by the sound of the door opening. Enter MR. LOWERY, accompanied by his client, TOM CASSIDY, who deals in oil leases. Lowery greets Mary with a somewhat awkward smile and attempts to steer Cassidy toward his private office. However, Cassidy pauses at Mary's desk, perching a haunch on the edge and flashing a smile that is as slick as it is unsettling. Mary glances up but finds herself unable to return his smile or engage in conversation; she continues sorting through the deed copies, doing her best to disregard the uncomfortable closeness of Cassidy's warm breath. Cassidy eventually straightens up, makes his way toward Lowery's office, stops, and delivers a remark to Mary that carries a weight of meaning. Lowery is about to follow, but hesitates, turning back to glance at Mary. Cassidy has already entered Lowery's office. Lowery hurries after him when it seems Cassidy might literally drag him inside. Once the men have disappeared and the door is securely closed, Caroline picks up a bundle, beaming at it. Mary places one bundle into a large envelope, takes the other from Caroline, and after securing the bills, she tucks the filled envelope into her handbag. She notices the remaining deed copies on her desk, gathers them up, and approaches the private office door. She knocks gently and begins to open the door as...

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Mary, upon noticing the radiant and genuine smile on his face, feels an undeniable urge to respond. She reaches out with gentle assertiveness and pulls him closer to her, pressing her lips to his in a tender, lingering kiss that speaks volumes. Without interrupting their intimate connection, she gracefully swings her legs over the side of the bed. Her toes sweep across the floor in a gentle search for her shoes until she locates them, slipping her feet comfortably into each one with practiced ease. Finally, she gently pulls away from him, sitting up to steady herself before rising gracefully to her feet. She moves over to the bureau, retrieves a pair of delicate, small earrings from within her bag, and begins to put them on, deliberately choosing not to glance at her reflection in the mirror—whether due to indifference or a deliberate desire to avoid seeing herself, it remains unclear. Sam watches her intently, his face marked by a genuine concern, yet he remains unable to suppress the cheerful, humorous disposition he naturally possesses. Throughout the remainder of this scene, they both attend to a variety of mundane tasks such as dressing and combing their hair. She finds herself gazing at him, momentarily taken aback by his readiness and willingness to sustain their affair under her terms. It is a revelation that astonishes many women when they come to realize that men often persist in their interest even after the initial allure has subsided. With reassuring warmth and tenderness, Sam gently places his hands on her arms, speaking with unadorned sincerity. Yet as he moves away, the weight of his own burdens begins to press down on him, dissipating the lightness of his earlier humor. He gazes at her intently before drawing her closer once more for a tender, fleeting kiss, then turns his attention outward, gazing at the expansive, blue sky. Mary exits swiftly, closing the door quietly behind her, as Sam, now lost in his contemplation, stares down at his bare feet with a sense of melancholy. The scene shifts to a modestly successful office, strategically located just off the main street. We see Mary as she steps out of a cab, pays the driver, and crosses the pavement with purpose to enter the office building. Once inside, she walks directly to her desk, where she sits down and massages her temples in an attempt to relieve the tension she feels, eventually looking over to Caroline, a young woman who is just out of her teens. With a start, Caroline rises and begins to approach Mary's desk, a bottle of pills in hand, but she is interrupted by the sound of the door swinging open. Enter MR. LOWERY, accompanied by TOM CASSIDY, his client who deals primarily in oil leases. Lowery greets Mary with a somewhat awkward smile, attempting to steer Cassidy toward his private office. However, Cassidy pauses at Mary's desk, perching a haunch on the edge and flashing a smile that is as slick as it is unsettling. Mary glances up but finds herself unable to return his smile or engage in conversation; she continues sorting through the deed copies, doing her best to disregard the uncomfortable closeness of Cassidy's warm breath. Eventually, Cassidy straightens up, makes his way toward Lowery's private office, but stops along the way, delivering a remark to Mary that carries its own weight of meaning. Lowery, about to follow, hesitates momentarily, turning back to glance at Mary. Cassidy has already entered Lowery's office. Lowery then hurries after him, appearing as though Cassidy might literally drag him inside. Once the men have disappeared and the door is securely closed behind them, Caroline picks up a bundle, beaming broadly at it. Mary places one of the bundles into a large envelope, takes the other from Caroline, and after carefully securing the bills, she tucks the filled envelope safely into her handbag. She notices the remaining deed copies on her desk, gathers them up with precision, and approaches the private office door. She knocks gently, beginning to open the door as...

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mary is captivated by his smile and feels compelled to react, so she gently pulls him towards her and kisses him. As their lips remain locked, she maneuvers her body to swing her legs over the side of the bed, letting her toes explore the floor in search of her shoes. Once her feet locate the shoes, she slips into them with practiced ease. She then disengages from the kiss and sits upright, transitioning into a standing position to move gracefully towards the bureau. There, she reaches into her bag to extract a pair of small earrings and begins the task of putting them on, deliberately avoiding any glance at her reflection in the mirror, perhaps out of disinterest or a desire to avoid self-examination. Meanwhile, Sam observes her actions closely, his concern evident in his gaze, but his naturally cheerful and humorous disposition is hard to suppress. As the scene unfolds, both of them continue with the mundane rituals of dressing and grooming, such as combing their hair. Mary regards Sam with a mix of surprise and introspection, taken aback by his willingness to sustain their affair completely on her terms. This sense of astonishment stems from the common notion that men might lose interest once the allure of mystery is gone. Sam, maintaining his reassuring demeanor, places his hands gently on her arms and speaks with sincere simplicity. After this intimate exchange, he moves away, allowing the burdens of his own unresolved pain and issues to overshadow his temporary good mood. He takes a long, meaningful look at Mary, drawing her close for a tender, light kiss, before directing his gaze out the window, losing himself in the vast expanse of the sky. Mary chooses this moment to leave, exiting the room swiftly and closing the door behind her, leaving Sam to look down pensively at his shoeless feet. Later, in a small, moderately successful office situated off the main street, Mary steps out of a cab, pays the driver promptly, and crosses the pavement with a determined stride toward the office door. Upon entering the office, she heads directly to her desk, sits down, and rubs her temples as if to alleviate some unseen tension, before finally casting her gaze toward Caroline, a young girl nearing the end of her teenage years. Caroline rises from her seat, making her way toward Mary's desk with pills in hand, but stops midway, distracted by the sound of the door opening. MR. LOWERY enters, accompanied by an oil-lease client, TOM CASSIDY. Lowery, flashing an awkward smile in Mary's direction, attempts to guide Cassidy towards the private office. However, Cassidy lingers beside Mary's desk, perching himself partially on the desktop, and flashes Mary an overly familiar smile. Mary, feeling uncomfortable, steals a brief glance at him but refrains from smiling or making small talk, choosing instead to focus intently on sorting through the deed copies, doing her best to ignore his intrusively close and hot breath. Cassidy eventually rises and staggers toward Lowery's office but not before turning to address Mary with a significant look. Lowery, sensing the urgency of Cassidy's actions, starts to follow him but halts momentarily to acknowledge Mary. When Cassidy finally disappears into Lowery's office, Lowery quickly follows to avoid being physically dragged in by Cassidy's bullish intent. Once the men are securely behind the closed door, Caroline picks up a bundle and smiles at it, handing one of the parcels over to Mary. Mary efficiently tucks the bundle into a large envelope she has on hand, accepting the other one from Caroline with a nod. After securing the bills inside the envelope, she places it in her handbag, takes note of the remaining deed copies on her desk, gathers them up, and approaches the private office door. She knocks gently, pushing the door open slightly as she prepares to enter.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Mary responds to his smile by pulling him closer and kissing him. Without breaking the kiss, she swings her legs over the bed, finds her shoes with her toes, and slips them on. She then pulls away, sits up, and rises to retrieve a pair of earrings from her bag, putting them on without glancing in the mirror. Sam watches her, concerned yet maintaining his cheerful demeanor. They continue getting ready, and Mary, surprised by Sam's willingness to maintain their affair, stares at him. Sam reassures her with a smile, gently touches her arms, and speaks sincerely before moving away, feeling the weight of his troubles return. He looks at her deeply, pulls her close for a light kiss, then gazes out at the sky. Mary quickly exits, closing the door behind her while Sam looks down at his bare feet.

Later, Mary exits a cab, pays the driver, and enters a modest office off the main street. Inside, she heads to her desk, sits down, rubs her temples, and glances at Caroline, a young colleague. Caroline approaches with pills but is distracted by the sound of the door opening. MR. LOWERY and TOM CASSIDY enter, and Lowery, embarrassed, tries to lead Cassidy to the private office. Cassidy lingers at Mary's desk, smiling at her; Mary, however, remains focused on sorting deed copies and ignores his presence. Cassidy eventually follows Lowery into the office. Once the door closes behind them, Caroline smiles at a bundle she's holding. Mary places one bundle into a large envelope, exchanges another with Caroline, and stows the filled envelope in her handbag. Noticing the remaining copies, she collects them and approaches the private office door, ready to knock and enter.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Mary looks at his smile, has to respond, pulls him to her, and kisses him. Then, without breaking the kiss, she swings her legs over the side of the bed, toe-searches around as she often does when in a hurry each morning, finds her shoes, and slips her feet into them. Finally, she pulls away and sits up. She rises, goes to the bureau, which had been a vintage piece from her grandmother's estate, takes a pair of small earrings out of her bag, and begins putting them on, not bothering or perhaps not wanting to look at herself in the mirror, which was slightly cracked from an accidental bump years ago. Sam watches her, concerned but unable to inhibit his cheery, humorous good mood that he maintained even through adversity. Throughout the remainder of this scene, they occupy themselves with dressing, hair-combing, etc. She stares at him, surprised at his willingness to continue the affair on her terms, as girls are so often surprised when they discover men will continue to want them even after the sexual bait has been pulled in, a notion often explored in contemporary relationship discussions. Sam smiles reassuringly, places his hands gently on her arms, and speaks with gentle and simple sincerity. He moves away, and again the weight of his pain and problems, stemming from a long-standing family dispute, crushes away his good humor. He looks at her long, pulls her close, kisses her lightly as if savoring the fleeting moment, looks out the window, and stares at the wide sky, a sprawling expanse where he finds solace. Mary goes out quickly, closing the door behind her, as Sam stares down at his shoeless feet, the result of a hurried morning that left little time for preparation. A small, moderately successful office off the main street, nestled among a row of similar buildings offering various services, we see Mary get out of a cab, pay the driver, known to be a chatty local named Joe, cross the pavement to the office door. Mary enters the office, crosses to her desk, sits down, rubs her temples as if warding off a forming headache, and finally looks over at Caroline, a girl in the last of her teens who was interning there for her summer break. Caroline rises and starts for Mary's desk, pills in hand, but breaks off, distracted by the SOUND of the door opening. MR. LOWERY, who managed the office with a strict but fair hand, and his oil-lease client, TOM CASSIDY, a notorious big spender in town, enter the office. Lowery flashes an embarrassed smile at Mary and tries to lead Cassidy toward the private office. Cassidy pauses beside Mary's desk, hooks a haunch onto the desktop, a gesture he often used to assert dominance, and smiles a wet smile at Mary. Mary glances but cannot bring herself to smile or make some remark, continues sorting out the deed copies crucial to the day's transactions, and tries to ignore the man's hot-breath closeness, a discomforting presence for many. Cassidy rises, reels toward Lowery's office, pauses, turns, and speaks to Mary meaningfully, hinting at a personal interest. Lowery starts after him but pauses and turns to Mary, quietly conveying his apologies for Cassidy's forwardness. Cassidy has gone into Lowery's office. Lowery starts quickly away when it looks like Cassidy is going to come and pull him bodily into the office, a habit Cassidy had when impatient. When the men are gone and the door is closed, Caroline picks up a bundle, her weekly workload, and smiles at it. Mary has put one bundle into a large envelope containing sensitive documents and takes the other from Caroline. When the bills are away, she puts the filled envelope in her handbag, notices the remaining deed copies on her desk, picks them up, goes to the private office door, knocks, and starts to open the door as she always does when checking in with her boss.

A small moderately successful office off the main street. we see Mary get out of a cab. pay the driver cross the pavement to the office door. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Mary enters the office crosses to her desk sits down rubs her temples and finally looks over at Caroline. a girl in the last of her teens. Caroline rises and starts for Mary's desk pills in hand but breaks off distracted by the SOUND of the door opening. MR LOWERY and his oillease client TOM CASSIDY enter the office. Lowery flashes an embarrassed smile at Mary and tries to lead Cassidy toward the private office. Cassidy pauses beside Mary's desk hooks a haunch onto the desktop and smiles a wet smile at Mary. Mary glances but cannot bring herself to smile or make some remark continues sorting out the deed copies and tries to ignore the man's hotbreath closeness. Cassidy rises reels toward Lowery's office pauses turns and speaks to Mary meaningfully. Lowery starts after him but pauses and turns to Mary. Cassidy has gone into Lowery's office. Lowery starts quickly away when it looks like Cassidy is going to come and pull him bodily into the office. When the men are gone and the door is closed Caroline picks up a bundle and smiles at it. Mary has put one bundle into a large envelope and takes the other from Caroline. When the bills are away she puts the filled envelope in her handbag notices the remaining deed copies on her desk picks them up. goes to the private office door knocks and starts to open the door as.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Mary gazes at his smile, feels compelled to laugh, nudges him playfully, and hugs him. Then, without interrupting the hug, she swings her legs off the side of the bed, taps around, locates her shoes, and places her feet into them. Finally, she releases him and sits upright. She stands, heads to the bureau, retrieves a pair of small earrings from her bag, and starts wearing them, not caring or perhaps not needing to glance at herself in the mirror. Sam observes her, intrigued but unable to suppress his playful, humorous good mood. Throughout the rest of this scene, they busy themselves with adjusting outfits, brushing their hair, etc. She gazes at him, amazed at his readiness to continue the affair on her terms, as girls are so often amazed when they notice men will persist in desiring them even after the emotional bait has been withdrawn. Sam grins reassuringly, places his hands softly on her shoulders, and speaks with heartfelt and straightforward sincerity. He steps away, and again the gravity of his sorrows and troubles diminishes his good humor. He gazes at her deeply, draws her near, embraces her briefly, looks toward the window, and gawks at the open sky. Mary departs swiftly, shutting the door behind her, as Sam gazes down at his sockless feet. A compact, moderately successful office off the main street, we see Mary hop out of a cab, tip the driver, stride across the pavement to the office entrance. Mary steps into the office, walks to her desk, takes a seat, massages her temples, and eventually glances over at Caroline, a girl in the last of her teens. Caroline stands and heads for Mary's desk, papers in hand, but halts, distracted by the SOUND of the door creaking open. MR. LOWERY and his oil-lease client, TOM CASSIDY, step into the office. Lowery gives an awkward grin at Mary and tries to guide Cassidy toward the private office. Cassidy hesitates beside Mary's desk, props a hip onto the desktop, and beams a broad smile at Mary. Mary glances but cannot bring herself to grin or make some comment, continues organizing the deed copies, and tries to ignore the man's invasive presence. Cassidy stands, totters toward Lowery's office, pauses, turns, and addresses Mary thoughtfully. Lowery moves after him but pauses and turns to Mary. Cassidy has entered Lowery's office. Lowery swiftly moves away when it seems like Cassidy is going to come and drag him physically into the office. When the men are gone and the door is sealed, Caroline lifts a bundle and grins at it. Mary has placed one bundle into a large envelope and receives the other from Caroline. When the bills are stashed, she places the filled envelope in her handbag, notices the leftover deed copies on her desk, picks them up, heads to the private office door, taps gently, and starts to push the door open as.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption

Then, without breaking the kiss, she swings her arms over the side of the fence, finger-searches around, finds her hat, and slips her hands into it. Finally, she pulls away and sits down. She rises, goes to the dresser, takes a pair of tiny bracelets out of her backpack, and begins putting them on, not bothering or perhaps not wanting to look at herself in the window. Max observes her, worried but unable to inhibit its cheerful, witty great disposition. test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Lucas glances at her frown, feels compelled to comment, nudges her away, and pats her shoulder. Then, without losing the connection, he dangles his arms over the edge of the couch, finger-traces around, finds his book, and slides it onto his lap. Finally, he steps back and sighs deeply. He stretches, heads to the closet, extracts a pair of colorful socks from his drawer, and begins unfolding them, not considering or perhaps avoiding looking at himself in the reflection. Anna observes him, amused but unable to suppress her mischievous, playful disposition. Throughout the remainder of this scene, they entertain themselves with reading, nail-painting, etc. He gazes at her, astonished by her eagerness to prolong their argument under his conditions, as boys are so often bewildered when they discover women will continue to engage even after the emotional bait has been withdrawn. Anna grins supportively, places her hands softly on his shoulders, and communicates with gentle and straightforward candor. She steps aside, and once more the weight of her amusement and intentions dissolves her mischief. test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Mary kisses Sam before getting dressed. Sam observes her affectionately, pleased she wants to continue the affair. After a tender exchange, Mary leaves quickly. At her office, she pays a cab driver, arrives at her desk, and exchanges a brief interaction with Caroline. Mr. Lowery and Tom Cassidy enter, with Cassidy making Mary uncomfortable with his flirting. Ignoring him, Mary focuses on sorting documents. After the men go into Lowery's office, Caroline hands Mary a bundle. Mary places a filled envelope in her bag, collects remaining documents, and approaches the private office door.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order

starts quickly away when it looks like Cassidy is going to come and pull him bodily into the office Cassidy has gone into Lowery's office Lowery starts after him but pauses and turns to Mary Cassidy rises reels toward Lowery's office pauses turns and speaks to Mary meaningfully Mary glances but cannot bring herself to smile or make some remark continues sorting out the deed copies and tries to ignore the man's hotbreath closeness Cassidy pauses beside Mary's desk hooks a haunch onto the desktop and smiles a wet smile at Mary Lowery flashes an embarrassed smile at Mary and tries to lead Cassidy toward the private office MR LOWERY and his oillease client TOM CASSIDY enter the office Caroline rises and starts for Mary's desk pills in hand but breaks off distracted by the SOUND of the door opening a girl in the last of her teens Mary enters the office crosses to her desk sits down rubs her temples and finally looks over at Caroline pay the driver cross the pavement to the office door we see Mary get out of a cab A small moderately successful office off the main street Mary goes out quickly closing the door behind her as Sam stares down at his shoeless feet He looks at her long pulls her close kisses her lightly looks out the window and stares at the wide sky He moves away and again the weight of his pain and problems crushes away his good humor Sam smiles reassuringly places his hands gently on her arms and speaks with gentle and simple sincerity She stares at him surprised at his willingness to continue the affair on her terms as girls are so often surprised when they discover men will continue to want them even after the sexual bait has been pulled in Throughout the remainder of this scene they occupy themselves with dressing haircombing etc Sam watches her concerned but unable to inhibit his cheery humorous good mood She rises goes to the bureau takes a pair of small earrings out of her bag and begins putting them on not bothering or perhaps not wanting to look at herself in the mirror Finally she pulls away and sits up Then without breaking the kiss she swings her legs over the side of the bed toesearches around finds her shoes and slips her feet into them Mary looks at his smile has to respond pulls him to her and kisses him
